Allow the user to restore items for a tree
Allow the user to partial restore items
Allow the user to compare items between workspaces
Allow the user to import content, schema and files from an exported archive file
Allow the user to export content, schema and files to an archive file
You are about to transfer %0% directly to %1%, without adding it to the queue.
This will put %0% in the queue for the next transfer, nothing will be transfered yet.
Should all items below %0% be included in the transfer?
The published or unpublished status will be transferred along with the content. To schedule the update for publishing in the future, please set a date:

Changes have been queued

When you are ready to transfer your full set of changes, go to the workspace dashboard to start the transfer.

This includes changes to referenced content, media and other items.

Notice: Restoring a large number of items can take a long time to perform. Whilst this operation is proceeding you should not make changes to your Umbraco data or initiate any further deploy operations.

This will transfer changes from %0% for all items and apply them to this workspace.

Notice: Restoring a large number of items can take a long time to perform. Whilst this operation is proceeding you should not make changes to your Umbraco data or initiate any further deploy operations.

This will transfer changes from %0% and apply them to the selected tree in this workspace. This will include changes to any referenced content, media or other items.

Notice: Restoring a large number of items can take a long time to perform. Whilst this operation is proceeding you should not make changes to your Umbraco data or initiate any further deploy operations.

Include content dependencies (e.g. related media and content)
Include content file dependencies (e.g. media files)
Include schema dependencies (e.g. document and data types)
Include schema file dependencies (e.g. templates, scripts and stylesheets)
Update Umbraco Schema From Data Files
Update the Umbraco schema based on the information contained in the .uda files on disk.
Extract the schema from Umbraco and output it to the .uda files on disk.

Clear the cached artifact signatures from the Umbraco environment.
This should not be necessary in normal use. This may solve reports of schema mismatches when transferring content between environments that have been aligned.

Sets the cached artifact signatures for all entities within the Umbraco environment. This can be used when signatures have been cleared and you want to ensure they are pre-generated before attempting a potentially long-running restore or transfer operation.
Delete all temporary import ZIP archives

When carrying out a Deploy import, the uploaded ZIP archive will be temporarily stored on disk. Once the import has completed or the dialog is closed normally, this file will be automatically removed. In case this isn't triggered, you can manually delete all temporary import ZIP archives here.

When carrying out a Deploy export, the ZIP archive is stored on the local file system to subsequently be downloaded. After download the export archive can be deleted, but if this isn't done you can manually delete all exported ZIP archives here.
